name: Starhawk (Stakar Ogord)
description: Though best known as a 31st century hero in the alternate Reality-691 timeline, the enigmatic, space-faring Starhawk originated a millennium earlier.

wiki.aliases: "The One Who Knows", "The Light", "the Giver of Light", "Hadji"
wiki.place_of_birth: Sisters of Mercy nunnery on the planet [[Vespar (Earth-691)|Vesper]]
wiki.relatives: [[Kismet (Earth-691)|Kismet]] (Her of the 691 reality, mother); [[Quasar (Wendell Vaughn, (Earth-691)|Quasar]] (father,deceased) & Vaughn family (deceased); [[Warlock, Adam (Earth-691)|Warlock]] (uncle reality-691); [[Ogord (Earth-691)|Ogord]] (adoptive father, deceased), Salaan (adoptive mother)-all reality-691, [[Ogord, Aleta|Aleta Ogord]] (ex-wife and adoptive sister), Tara and Sita Ogord (daughters, deceased), John Ogord (son, deceased)-all reality-691; many unidentified additional adoptive parents within reality-691 and other alternate timelines
wiki.groups: Formerly [[Avengers]] (honorary member in the 616 Reality), [[Guardians of the Galaxy]]
wiki.education: Unrevealed, this includes the vast accumulated knowledge from centuries of study and having relived countless variations of his own life through a series of time loops.
wiki.powers: Starhawk can generate luminous energy for various purposes. He can surround his body with in a nimbus of light providing simple illumination up to blinding intensity. He can cast beams of light as spotlights of flares. By shifting his light beam's frequency, he can generate intense heat beams, or coherent light beams that strike their targets with tremendous concussive force. He uses a nimbus of intermingled photons and anti-gravitons to levitate or fly at great speeds.
wiki.origin: Marvel Presents #9-11 (1977); Guardians of the Galaxy #7, 45, 49-50 & 61-62 (1990, 1994 & 1995)
wiki.bio_text: Though best known as a 31st century hero in the alternate Reality-691 timeline, the enigmatic, space-faring Starhawk originated a millennium earlier. His power was granted to him by the [[Hawk God (Earth-691)|Hawk God]] of Arcturus. He was a vastly powerful cosmic being embodying the predatory nature of existence. The Hawk God's influence and actions were often destructive, but they fulfilled a greater universal purpose. His fellow cosmic beings felt that he was power-crazed, excessively violent and gratuitously cruel. The cosmic being known as [[Eternity (Earth-691)|Eternity]] brought charges against the Hawk God for causing the near-total extinction of the [[Watchers (Earth-691)|Watchers]]. The Hawk God was tried before the council of cosmic equals and the [[Living Tribunal]] performed the position of judge. The Hawk God was prosecuted by the last surviving Watcher, [[Ulig (Earth-691)|Ulig]], and defended by the world devourer [[Galactus(Earth-691)|Galactus]] who sympathized with the Hawk God's predatory nature. [[image:Quasar and Kismet of the 20th Century.jpg|thumb|Starhawk's parents, Quasar and Kismet of the 20th Century|left]]
wiki.bio:
Though best known as a 31st century hero in the alternate Reality-691 timeline, the enigmatic, space-faring Starhawk originated a millennium earlier. His power was granted to him by the [[Hawk God (Earth-691)|Hawk God]] of Arcturus. He was a vastly powerful cosmic being embodying the predatory nature of existence. The Hawk God's influence and actions were often destructive, but they fulfilled a greater universal purpose. His fellow cosmic beings felt that he was power-crazed, excessively violent and gratuitously cruel. The cosmic being known as [[Eternity (Earth-691)|Eternity]] brought charges against the Hawk God for causing the near-total extinction of the [[Watchers (Earth-691)|Watchers]]. The Hawk God was tried before the council of cosmic equals and the [[Living Tribunal]] performed the position of judge. The Hawk God was prosecuted by the last surviving Watcher, [[Ulig (Earth-691)|Ulig]], and defended by the world devourer [[Galactus(Earth-691)|Galactus]] who sympathized with the Hawk God's predatory nature. [[image:Quasar and Kismet of the 20th Century.jpg|thumb|Starhawk's parents, Quasar and Kismet of the 20th Century|left]]
The Living Tribunal declared the Hawk God dangerous, partly because he was thought to be a likely instigator of the long-prophesied reality-threatening War of the Cosmic Beings. The Hawk God was sent back to the planet Arcturus IV, around Earth's early 20th Century. He was among the gods worshiped by the early Arturians, and they constructed a 30' robotic computer in his likeness. Upon his demotion, the Hawk God was trapped in this immense replica, in an inactive state. 


The humanoid Arcturian race is presumed to be violent and unstable, this trait is thought to be a side effect of the constant daylight, due to the planet having twin suns. They measure their lifespans in centuries instead of years. The Acrturians also practice genetic engineering. This practice ended in a planet wide nuclear war. 

Starhawk recently returned, changed to a female form and later sacrificed his life to save the current Guardians team.
